text:
The version of JMeter I am using is a CVS checkout at Fri Aug 23 01:33:17  2002 
UTC/GMT.

This fault report is a 'formalization' of an unresolved issue discussed in the 
JMeter Users mailing list.

When saving a Test Plan that contains an HTTP Request that sets a parameter 
value using ${__regexFunction(ENCODED_ARGS_FROM_FUNCTION_HELPER_DLG)}, if the 
parameter is UNencoded (ie 'Encoded?' is NOT ticked), the regex function args 
lose their encoding in the XML .jmx file.

When the Test Plan .jmx is opened later, the regex function args are a 
plain/unencoded character string, and the regex no longer functions as intended.

Workaround: ALWAYS encode the HTTP Request parameter (ie 'Encoded?' IS ticked). 
This in turn has the side effect that the value of the parameter (which is 
partially constructed from the substitution value/result of the regex function) 
is encoded.
